posts.title: Dirty
posts.excerpt: Quote:DIRTY is the reincarnation of two girls, a bottle and one bed. Their bodies, hands and face expressions reach out in a refilm look.

posts._title: Bregtje van der Haak – Lagos / Koolhaas (2002)
posts.title: Lagos / Koolhaas
posts.excerpt: Rem Koolhaas – winner of architecture’s Nobel, the Pritzker Architecture Prize – is a Professor of Architecture and Urban Design at Harvard. For the past four years Koolhaas and students from The Harvard Project on the City have come to Lagos regularly to research the type of urban environment that is produced by explosive population …

posts.title: City of Shadows
posts.excerpt: Gangster Big Tim Channing raises young newsboy Dan Mason as his own son.

posts._title: R.G. Springsteen – Out of the Storm (1948)
posts.title: Out of the Storm
posts.excerpt: Former “Henry Aldrich” James Lydon acquits himself nicely in a serious role in Republic’s Out of the Storm. Lydon plays Donald Lewis, a low-paid clerk in a high-profile shipbuilding firm. When the company is robbed in broad daylight, Lewis gathers up $100,000 on his own and skeedaddles, figuring that the lost funds will be attributed …

posts.title: The Naked Street
posts.excerpt: PlotRoselle Regalzyk (Anne Bancroft) is the naughty but nice little sister of mobster Phil “Regal” (Anthony Quinn). The unwed Roselle has managed to get herself pregnant by Nick Branda (Farley Granger), another convict who is soon on his way to the electric chair. Phil no sooner has Nick sprung so that he can marry Roselle, …

posts._title: Valeria Sarmiento – La dueña de casa aka La femme au foyer (1975)
posts.title: La dueña de casa
posts.excerpt: The life of a right-wing housewife in Chile during the prior days to Salvador Allende’s military overthrow.

posts._title: Chris Marker – Trois Vidéos Haïkus AKA Three Video Haikus (1994)
posts.title: Trois Vidéos Haïkus
posts.excerpt: A collection of three short ‘haiku videos’ by Chris Marker. The first haiku, ‘Yanka / Tchaika’, shows the river Seine passing under a bridge. A bird in flight stays motionless in the air. The second haiku, ‘Owl Gets in Your Eyes’, shows Catherine Belkhodja smoking a cigarette while a superimposed shot of an owl in …

posts.title: The Blockhouse
posts.excerpt: The Blockhouse was a 1973 film, based on a book by Jean Paul Clebert. It was directed by Clive Rees and starred Peter Sellers and Charles Aznavour. It was filmed entirely in Guernsey in the Channel Islands.

posts.title: Lives of Performers
posts.excerpt: A stark and revealing examination of romantic alliances, Lives Of Performers examines the dilemma of a man who can’t choose between two women and makes them both suffer. Originally part of a dance performance choreographed by Rainer.
